main event: A detailed report on an unidentified flying object as reported in Sioux City, Iowa on 2nd January 1954, described as 1/3 the size of the moon with a green/orange tail observed at 30-50 feet elevation while the car was moving at 50 mph for 5-10 seconds.
interesting points: The object was described as having a 1/3 size of the moon with a green/orange tail and observed at a low elevation while the car was in motion.
The report concluded it to be an astronomical meteor, possibly astronomical, despite the description differing from a typical meteor.
The sighting lasted for about 24 seconds with a velocity estimated to be 1,500 MPH.
The report mentioned multiple sightings by four separated observers at different altitudes ranging from 10,000' to 50,000' and the reports show that objects were in the sight for about four hours.

The report also includes a letter from the President of 'Flying Saucers International' to the Director of Ground Observer Corps/Air Filter Center, requesting information about unidentified objects seen over Sioux City, Iowa.
